title: Fleeing Ukraine alone, resourceful teenager persuades Hungarian school to take her in
description: It's a normal school day for students at the Korosi Baptist High School in Budapest, Hungary -- studying, presenting classwork, laughing with friends.

title: Russian oligarch's luxury yacht seized in Spain at US' request
description: A 255-foot luxury yacht owned by a Russian billionaire was seized by Spanish law enforcement on Monday at the request of US officials, according to the Justice Department.

title: Inside the Colorado steel plant owned by a company accused of potentially supplying Russia's military
description: The steel mill that looms over low-slung neighborhoods in Pueblo, Colorado, is a rare bright spot for American manufacturing. Once part of the state's largest private employer, pumping out steel that was used to build rail lines across the Western US, it is now in the midst of a major expansion and recently became the world's first steel plant to run almost entirely on solar power.

title: Footage of Prince as an 11-year-old is unearthed by a Minnesota news station
description: A CNN affiliate station in Minneapolis stumbled upon a rare gem -- archival footage of the late, great icon Prince at 11 years old, supporting public school teachers on strike.

title: CNN crew survives close call in area under Russian assault
description: CNN's Ben Wedeman details the harrowing experience when his entire crew came close to a Russian artillery fire ear Mykolaiv, Ukraine.

title: At least 20 killed in Ecuador prison riot
description: Ecuadorian authorities said Monday they are in "total control" of a prison in the south of the country after a riot broke out the day before, killing at least 20 inmates.

title: Biden calls for war crimes trial after Bucha images surface
description: President Joe Biden on Monday called the atrocities allegedly committed by Russian forces in Bucha, Ukraine, a "war crime" and called for a trial to take place against Russian President Vladimir Putin.

title: In Russia's military, a culture of brutality runs deep
description: The grotesque pictures emerging from the Kyiv suburb of Bucha are some of the strongest evidence yet of apparent war crimes by Russian forces in Ukraine: Dead civilians on the street, some with hands bound and shot execution-style, others apparently mowed down at random.

title: There is no 'magic moment' to lift Covid-19 restrictions, researchers say
description: Pandemic hospitalization rates are at new lows, the vast majority of US counties have low community levels of the coronavirus, and as of March 25, all 50 states have lifted mask requirements.

title: Photos show destruction of world's largest airplane in Ukraine
description: Its fuselage is a charred and twisted gaping hole. Its gigantic wings are slumped to the ground, one of its engines burned and destroyed.

title: Opinion: Putin knows controlling history is the key to total power
description: Like previous wars, Russia's assault on Ukraine is an attack not only on the living but also on the dead, whose traces in the historical record risk being completely erased if evidence of the past -- including iconic physical structures, archives and documents are destroyed -- whether intentionally or accidentally.

title: 'The Russians are gone': What this image says about Russia's strategy
description: Retired US Army Maj. Gen. Paul Eaton says that satellite images showing the absence of Russian troops at an airport near Kyiv indicates that Putin is shifting his strategy to focus on the Donbas region in eastern Ukraine.

title: Elon Musk buys 9.2% stake in Twitter, making him the largest shareholder
description: Elon Musk recently purchased 9.2% of Twitter stock, according to a filing Monday, making him the largest individual shareholder in the company.

title: Satellite pollution is threatening to alter our view of the night sky and possibly our lives
description: Our view of the night sky, the same shared throughout human history, is about to change. Some scientists warn that the influx of satellites may impact NASA's early detection of potentially killer asteroids.

title: Of course Donald Trump endorsed Sarah Palin
description: Without Sarah Palin, there is no Donald Trump.

title: Landmark UN report delivers 'damning' verdict on humanity's fight against climate change
description: Scientists and government representatives were locked in marathon talks late Sunday night in a race to complete the last installment of a landmark UN climate report, as a number of fossil fuel-producing nations objected to strong statements that the world must end its use of coal, oil and natural gas, a source familiar with the talks told CNN.

title: Silk Sonic, Olivia Rodrigo and Jon Batiste take home the top prizes at the Grammy Awards
In zero-Covid China, virus-hit Shanghai is too big to fail
description: When it comes to China's signature zero-Covid health policy, the country's leaders have made it clear: Shanghai is too big to fail.

title: Middle East oil exporters are cashing in as Ukraine war hits global economy
description: The Ukraine war is wreaking havoc on the world economy, but in the Middle East its impact hasn't been so grim for everyone.

title: The horrors of Putin's invasion of Ukraine are increasingly coming to light
Coke's latest flavor is here. And it's a weird one
description: Coke's recent foray into bold new flavors has its latest entry, and it's a doozy.

title: Russian missiles hit oil refinery in Ukrainian port city. CNN reports from the scene
description: Multiple Russian airstrikes hit a largely industrial area of the Ukrainian port city of Odesa, home to 1 million people. CNN's Ed Lavandera reports from the scene.

title: Carlos Alcaraz cements himself as hottest prospect in tennis with first career Masters 1000 title
description: When you're being praised both by the "King of Clay" and Spanish royalty it's clear you're having a special moment.

title: Why does coffee make you poop? Experts explain
description: For some people, coffee jump-starts their bowel movements in addition to their energy.

title: THC and CBD exposure in womb linked to childhood obesity, higher blood sugar, study says
description: Pregnant women who were exposed to cannabis products that contained THC and CBD were more likely to have children with increased fat mass and blood sugar levels at age 5, a new pilot study found.

title: China could make a U-turn to stop its companies being kicked off Wall Street
description: China is extending an olive branch to the United States in a bid to prevent Chinese firms from being kicked off the US stock market.

title: Chaotic scenes unfold in Sri Lanka over the country's worst economic crisis in decades
description: A string of cabinet ministers and the central bank governor have resigned in Sri Lanka, as protesters in the capital defy curfew orders amid the country's worst economic crisis in decades.

title: Man finds 7-foot snake behind couch cushion
description: A slithery surprise shocked a California man who found a 7-foot snake coiled up behind a couch cushion.  CNN affiliate KGTV reports.

title: Watch: Ukraine leader accuses Russia of genocide
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky says Russian forces are committing genocide in his country after images emerged of civilian bodies strewn across the street in Bucha, a city northwest of the capital Kyiv.

title: Grammy winners 2022: The full list
description: The 2022 Grammy Awards are being presented Sunday.

title: Best fashion on the Grammy red carpet
description: Stars are out in their Sunday best as they arrive on the red carpet for one of music's biggest nights: the Grammy Awards. The 64th edition, held this year at the MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas, was initially slated for January but was postponed due to Covid-19.

title: Imran Khan survives attempt to oust him as Pakistan's prime minister
description: Imran Khan survived an attempt to oust him as Pakistan's prime minister on Sunday, after a no-confidence vote was blocked in parliament by the deputy speaker.

title: Trump endorses Sarah Palin for Congress
description: Former President Donald Trump said he is endorsing former Alaska Gov. Sarah Palin in her bid to fill Alaska's at-large US House seat left vacant by the death last month of longtime Republican Rep. Don Young.

title: Watch Bryson DeChambeau play Masters course without a golf club
description: Bryson DeChambeau competed against popular YouTubers "Dude Perfect," throwing and swinging random sports equipment in a game of "All Sports Golf" on the iconic Masters greens.

title: Doja Cat stuns at Grammys red carpet in dreamy Versace gown
description: Doja Cat is up for eight awards at the 2022 Grammys, and the rapper and singer arrived on the red carpet in a sheer, sea foam-colored Versace gown looking like Grammys royalty.

title: Biden called Murdoch the 'most dangerous man in the world,' new book alleges
description: In a forthcoming book, a pair of New York Times reporters and CNN political analysts report that President Joe Biden "assessed" Fox News "as one of the most destructive forces in the United States."
